page.title: 02LOCAL HISTORY
page.content: There is a large house in Efford, Plymouth, which is built on the original site of Ebb Ford Manor House, which was mentioned in the original Domesday Book. The name Ebb Ford comes from the ford across the River Plym at ebb tide. The sunken lane and Devon hedges nearby are thought to be part of the original lane leading from the Manor House to the ford. The name Ebb Ford has gradually changed over the years to Efford, which is now the name of a suburb of Plymouth. The name Plymouth comes from the mouth of the River Plym, which is small river flowing from Dartmoor, but with a beautiful tidal estuary.
